Title: Source Code   
Country: USA 
USA release: 01/04/2011 
Released in Spain: 15/04/2011 
Released on DVD (rental): 03/08/2011 
Studio: Summit Entertainment 
Director: Duncan Jones 
Writer: Ben Ripley, Billy Ray 
Starring: Jake Gyllenhaal, Michelle Monaghan, Vera Farmiga, Jeffrey Wright, Brent Skagford, Cas Anvar, Michael Arden, Craig Thomas 
Rating: Not recommended for children under 12 years 


Synopsis: 
Captain Colter Stevens (Jake Gyllenhaal) wakes with a start on the inside of a Chicago commuter train. While all other passengers seem to know he has absolutely no idea where or even who he is. The last thing he remembers is to be flying by helicopter during a mission in Iraq, but here seems to be someone who will work in the morning like a normal day. But before he can do anything a train approaching from the opposite path and a bomb that apparently killed Colter and all other passengers. 

Colter then enters an isolation chamber, strapped to a chair and dressed in his military flight suit. I still have no idea what's going on, only being questioned by the mission controller Carol Goodwin (Vera Farmiga), who calmly recites a series of questions to which Colter is surprised to realize that knows the answers. He learns that it is part of an operation called a besieged castle, but before he can progress further Goodwin launches new machinery and suddenly ... 

... Colter is back on the train in exactly the same place that first appeared there, once again at full speed for Chicago with the same group of travelers. Colter figure out what is in some kind of simulation exercise and the task of finding the terrorist to board the train before the simulation is off again. Living the explosion again and again, Colter must discover the identity of the attacker while to figure out what the limits are provided by the alternate universe of Beleaguered Castle, adding to the puzzle the chances of a second chance to make amends with his father and find a potential partner among travelers on the train.
